newsitem.title: JAPAN: Janome sees bigger net on land sales, bank support.
newsitem.headline: Janome sees bigger net on land sales, bank support.

text.p: Janome Sewing Machine Co Ltd said on Friday it expects its parent net profit to rise in the year to March 31 after selling land and a head-office building, writing off some of its loans, and receiving planned financial support from Asahi Bank Ltd.
Janome will sell its headquarters and land in central Tokyo to a Tokyo-based property firm for 15.9 billion yen. of which 13.45 billion yen will be profit, Janome said in a statement.
Janome said it plans to obtain financial support from Asahi Bank, but it did not specify the nature or the amount of the support.
Janome said that this fiscal year to March 31 it would write off 21 billion yen of the 30 billion yen in loans it extended to Kabushiki Kaisha Nanatomi.
Janome said earlier on Friday that it would post a parent net profit of 900 million yen in 1996/97 against its earlier forecast of net profit of 100 million yen.
It posted a net loss of 112 million yen in 1995/96.
